meanings.definition: Excessive speed or urgency in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: She ran with great haste to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: In times of danger, acting with haste can be necessary.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gathered nuts with such haste that it tripped over itself.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed with the haste of a charging bull.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's haste to save the cat was admirable.

meanings.sent1: Please haste to finish your homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: We must haste if we want to make it to the movie on time.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to haste to prepare the meal for the impatient customer.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to haste by as they danced under the stars.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the room as they played in happy haste.
